title: Man in critical, teen in stable condition after shooting on Randolph Street
content:
JACKSON, MI - A Jackson man shot multiple times inside a home Thursday evening is in critical condition, police say.
The 22-year-old man is at Henry Ford Allegiance Health following the shooting at about 10:18 p.m., Jan. 12, in the 100 block of Randolph Street, said Interim Director of Police and Fire Services Elmer Hitt.
A second victim, a 13-year-old boy, suffered a single gunshot wound to the back. The teen was taken to the University of Michigan Health Center and is listed in stable condition, Hitt said.
Police believe earlier that evening there was a physical altercation between the 22-year-old victim and the shooting suspect, a 36-year-old Jackson man, Hitt said.
After the fight, the 36-year-old man left the home, returned with a firearm and fired several shots at the two victims, Hitt said.
While investigating the shooting, police received a call at 12:11 a.m. about another report of shots fired at a home on the 100 block of W. Morrell Street.
Police found the home had been struck multiple times and located the man suspected of the Randolph shooting inside the residence. There were no injuries reported in the Morrell Street shooting, Hitt said.
The man was arrested at the scene and charged with one count of felon in possession of ammunition. He is lodged in the Jackson County Jail waiting for arraignment, Hitt said.
